name: Mushroom Matar
history: Mushroom Matar is a popular dish in Indian cuisine, combining mushrooms and green peas in a flavorful curry. It's a versatile dish that can be found in home cooking and restaurants alike, often enjoyed with rice or Indian breads.
description: Mushroom Matar is a delightful curry made with succulent mushrooms and sweet green peas, cooked in a rich and creamy tomato-based sauce. It is typically seasoned with traditional Indian spices, offering a perfect balance of flavors.

instructions.title: SautÃ© Onions and Spices
instructions.description: Heat oil in a pan. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add onions and ginger-garlic paste. SautÃ© until the onions turn golden brown.

instructions.title: Add Tomatoes and Dry Spices
instructions.description: Add pureed tomatoes, turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and salt. Cook until the oil separates from the masala.

instructions.title: Cook Mushrooms and Peas
instructions.description: Add the sliced mushrooms and green peas. Cook for a few minutes until the mushrooms are tender.

instructions.title: Simmer the Curry
instructions.description: Add water to get the desired consistency. Bring the curry to a boil, then simmer for 10 minutes.

instructions.title: Finish with Garam Masala and Cream
instructions.description: Add garam masala and cream or coconut milk (if using). Stir well and cook for another 2-3 minutes.

instructions.title: Garnish and Serve
instructions.description: Garnish with chopped cilantro. Serve hot with naan, roti, or rice.

tips: Adjust the amount of chili to control the spice level.
Use fresh mushrooms for the best flavor.
variations: Add other vegetables like bell peppers or carrots for more nutrition.
For a vegan version, use coconut milk instead of cream.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 3 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on the stove or in a microwave until warm.
presentationTips: Serve in a traditional Indian serving bowl for an authentic look.
Garnish with a lemon wedge or a sprinkle of fresh herbs.
